help.help_description: It's really necessary to explain the purpose of this command?

embed_reply.title: Command list | prefix: {PREFIX}
embed_reply.description:
Website:
[{WEBSITE}]({WEBSITE})
Documentation:
[https://eduardozgz.gitbook.io/member-counter](https://eduardozgz.gitbook.io/member-counter)```css
{PREFIX}help (command name)
{PREFIX}counts
{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter [type] (custom channel name)
{PREFIX}newCategoryNameCounter [type] (custom category name)
{PREFIX}topicCounter [enable/disable] (#channels/all)
{PREFIX}setTopic (#channels) [topic]
{PREFIX}removeTopic (#channel)
{PREFIX}setDigit [number] [custom number]
{PREFIX}lang [lang code]
{PREFIX}prefix [new prefix]
{PREFIX}role [allow/deny] [@roles/all]
{PREFIX}seeSettings
{PREFIX}resetSettings
{PREFIX}upgradeServer
{PREFIX}profile
{PREFIX}info
{PREFIX}support
{PREFIX}donate
{PREFIX}api```
 **Info:** `()` means an optional parameter while `[]` means a required one

newChannelNameCounter.help_description:
Creates a channel name counter.
Usage: ```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter [type] (custom name)```
The first argument must be one of the following listed below

Available types:
-`members`
-`users`*
-`bots`*
-`onlinemembers`*
-`onlineusers`*
-`onlinebots`*
-`offlinemembers`*
-`offlineusers`*
-`offlinebots`*
-`bannedmembers`
-`channels`
-`roles`
-`memberswithrole`*
-`connectedusers`
* = Only available in the premium bot, see `{PREFIX}help upgradeServer`

 The second argument is optional, it is used to set a custom channel name, when you use the second argument, remember to write `{COUNT}` wherever you want to place the counter.

You can also create a category name counter, the options are the same, just replace the command to `{PREFIX}newCategoryNameCounter`

Counter that counts members:```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter members```
 With a custom name:```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter members Members: {COUNT}```
Count how many users has a role or roles:```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter memberswithrole @Admin @Mod {COUNT} Admins and mods```
newChannelNameCounter.no_perms: I need `Manage Channels` permission to create the channel.
newChannelNameCounter.no_perms_ban: I need `Ban members` permission to create the channel.

topicCounter.help_description:
Usage:```css
{PREFIX}topicCounter [enable/disable] (#channels/all)```
This command displays a real time member counter in a channel topic

Examples:
```css
{PREFIX}topicCounter enable
{PREFIX}topicCounter enable #general
{PREFIX}topicCounter enable #general #other-channel
{PREFIX}topicCounter disable all```
**!**  If you don't mention any channel like in the first example, the counter will be enabled/disabled in the current channel
 **!**  When you mention a channel it must match exactly its name, and you must use `#`
topicCounter.success_enable: The counter has been enabled on {CHANNELS}
topicCounter.success_disable: The counter has been disabled on {CHANNELS}

setDigit.help_description:
You should see `{PREFIX}help topicCounter` before using this command.
Customizes numbers that will be displayed, the number argument must be a normal number, the second argument could be anything, like an emoji or a normal number with markdown.
If the first argument is the word "reset", the numbers will be restored to the default ones.

Usage: ```{PREFIX}setDigit reset
{PREFIX}setDigit [number] [your custom number]```
Example: ```{PREFIX}setDigit 3 **3**```
With the previous example every 3 will be shown as a bold **3**
setDigit.reset_success: Numbers restored to the default ones.

setTopic.help_description:
You should see `{PREFIX}help topicCounter` before using this command.
You can customize the topic with this command, remember to write `{COUNT}` wherever you want to place the counter. You can also set a unique topic for different channels

If the first argument are channel mentions, the topic given will be only used in the mentioned channels, (remember to mention the channels with ``#``).

`{COUNT}` will show how many members your server has, you can use any of these counters instead:
-`{members}`
-`{users}`*
-`{bots}`*
-`{onlinemembers}*`
-`{onlineusers}*`
-`{onlinebots}*`
-`{offlinemembers}`*
-`{offlineusers}`*
-`{offlinebots}`*
-`{bannedmembers}`
-`{channels}`
-`{roles}`
-`{connectedusers}`
* = Only available in the premium bot, see `{PREFIX}help upgradeServer`

Examples:

This will set the topic for those channels without a specific topic defined```{PREFIX}setTopic Current members: {COUNT}```
This will display the given topic only in the first mentioned channels```{PREFIX}setTopic #general Current members: {COUNT}
{PREFIX}setTopic #general #other-channel Current members: {COUNT}```
setTopic.success: Topic customized for all channels without a custom one.
setTopic.success_unique: Topic customized for the following channels: {CHANNELS}
setTopic.no_topic: No topic were provided, more info: `{PREFIX}help setTopic`.

removeTopic.help_description:
You should see `{PREFIX}help topicCounter` before using this command.
This command removes channel topics that has been customized, here is a list of examples:

Removes the customized topic for channels without specific topic:```{PREFIX}removeTopic```
Remove specific topics that has been established by mentioning channels```{PREFIX}removeTopic #general #other-channel```
removeTopic.success_unique: Unique topic removed for the following channels: {CHANNELS}
removeTopic.error_missing_params: Error: Missing parameters, more info: `{PREFIX}help removeTopic`.

prefix.help_description:
Changes the bot prefix.

Usage:```{PREFIX}prefix [new prefix]```

role.help_description:
You can allow or deny roles to use bot administrative commands.
You can use ``all`` keyword to allow or deny all roles.
To see which roles are currently allowed use `{PREFIX}seeSettings``
```{PREFIX}role allow @Mod
{PREFIX}role allow @Mod @OtherRole
{PREFIX}role deny all```
role.error_no_roles_to_update: You must mention at least 1 role

seeSettings.help_description: Shows all bot settings for this server.

settings_message.allowed_roles_text: Allowed roles to use administrative commands:
settings_message.main_topic_text: Global topic (used for those without a custom one):
settings_message.warning_no_perms_text: \⚠️ = The bot cannot continue updating this channel due to lack of permissions

resetSettings.help_description: Restores the custom settings of this server to the default ones

update.help_description: If you think the counters are stuck use this command to update them again.
update.inProgress: Updating the counters, this may take a while.

upgradeServer.help_description: This command allows you to invite Member Counter Premium, to use this command you must have a premium account, which you can get by donating any amount: `{PREFIX}donate`.
upgradeServer.success:
Done! The next step is invite the premium bot:
{BOT_LINK}
upgradeServer.no_premium_account: You must have a premium account.
upgradeServer.error_cannot_upgrade: You can't upgrade the server because it already has premium.

lang.help_description: Changes the bot language for this server, you must have administrator permissions to run this command.
lang.error_not_found: I didn't find that language, try one of the following:

embed_reply.title: Enjoying my bot? Donate me! Any amount will be welcome: {DONATION_URL}

donate.error_exchange_fetch: Error while trying to fetch exchange rates

profile.help_description: Shows related information between you and this bot

commandHandler.invalid_channel: You can't run this command on a {TYPE} channel

getCounts.no_ban_perms: I need ban permissions to show this

common.error_unknown: Something went wrong, try again later.
common.error_no_admin: Only members with administrator permissions in this server can use this command.
